sen.j: 元興寺（がんごうじ）は、奈良市にある、南都七大寺の1つに数えられる寺院。
sen.e: Gango-ji Temple is a temple in Nara City, counting among Seven Great Temples of Nara.
Gango-ji Temple is a temple in Nara City, counted as one of Seven Great Temples of Nara.
sen.cmt: Countingをcounted asに変更しました。
sen.e: Gango-ji Temple is a temple in Nara City, counted as one of Seven Great Temples of Nara.

sen.j: 蘇我馬子が飛鳥に建立した、日本最古の本格的仏教寺院である飛鳥寺がその前身である。
sen.e: The predecessor of this temple was Asuka-dera Temple, the oldest orthodox Buddhist temple in Japan, which was erected in Asuka (an ancient capital of Japan during the Asuka period [538-710]) by SOGA-no-Umako.

The predecessor of this temple was Asuka-dera Temple, the oldest orthodox Buddhist temple in Japan, which was erected in Asuka (an ancient capital of Japan during the Asuka period [538-710]) by SOGA-no-Umako.

The predecessor of this temple was Asuka-dera Temple, the oldest orthodox Buddhist temple in Japan, which was erected in Asuka (an ancient capital of Japan during the Asuka period [538-710]) by SOGA-no-Umako.

sen.j: 法興寺は平城京遷都に伴って飛鳥から新都へ移転し、元興寺となった（ただし、飛鳥の法興寺も元の場所に残り、今日の飛鳥寺となっている）。
sen.e: Following the transfer of the national capital to the Heijo-kyo (an ancient capital of Japan in current Nara), Hoko-ji Temple was also transferred from Asuka to the new capital to become Gango-ji Temple (however, Hoko-ji Temple in Asuka remained in the original site to be today's Asuka-dera Temple).

Following the transfer of the national capital to the Heijo-kyo (an ancient capital of Japan in current Nara), Hoko-ji Temple was also transferred from Asuka to the new capital to become Gango-ji Temple (however, Hoko-ji Temple in Asuka remained in the original site to be today's Asuka-dera Temple).

Following the transfer of the national capital to the Heijo-kyo (an ancient capital of Japan in current Nara), Hoko-ji Temple was also transferred from Asuka to the new capital to become Gango-ji Temple (however, Hoko-ji Temple in Asuka remained in the original site to be today's Asuka-dera Temple).

sen.j: 奈良時代には近隣の東大寺、興福寺と並ぶ大寺院であった。
sen.e: Gango-ji Temple was a temple with an influence as much as neighboring Todai-ji Temple and Kofuku-ji Temple in the Nara period.
sen.cmt: 一例文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Gango-ji Temple was a temple with an influence as much as neighboring Todai-ji Temple and Kofuku-ji Temple in the Nara period.
Gango-ji Temple was a temple with an influence as much as neighboring Todai-ji Temple and Kofuku-ji Temple in the Nara period.

sen.j: しかし中世以降次第に衰退して、現在は次の2つの寺院に分かれている。
sen.e: However, having gradually declined since the medieval period, the temple is now divided into two temples as follows.
sen.cmt: 一例文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: However, having gradually declined since the medieval period, the temple is now divided into two temples as follows.
However, having gradually declined since the medieval period, the temple is now divided into two temples as follows.

sen.j: (1) 奈良市中院町所在の元興寺。
sen.e: (1) Gango-ji Temple in Chuin-cho, Nara City.
(1) Gango-ji Temple in Chuin-cho, Nara City.
(1) Gango-ji Temple in Chuin-cho, Nara City.

sen.j: 1977年までは「元興寺極楽坊」と称していた。
sen.e: It was referred to as "Gango-ji Temple Gokuraku-bo" until 1977.
It was referred to as 'Gango-ji Temple Gokuraku-bo' until 1977.
sen.cmt: 指示書に従い、“”を‘’に変更しました。
sen.e: It was referred to as 'Gango-ji Temple Gokuraku-bo' until 1977.

sen.j: 西大寺 (奈良市)の末寺で、宗派は真言律宗に属する。
sen.e: The temple is a branch temple of Saidai-ji Temple (Nara City), belonging to the Shingon Ritsu sect.
The temple is a branch temple of Saidai-ji Temple (Nara City), belonging to the Shingon Ritsu sect.
The temple is a branch temple of Saidai-ji Temple (Nara City), belonging to the Shingon Ritsu sect.

sen.j: 本尊は智光曼荼羅である。
sen.e: Honzon (principal object of worship at a temple) is Chiko Mandala (a diagram that depicts Buddhist deities according to certain geometric formats and illustrates the Buddhist world view).
The honzon (principal object of worship at a temple) is Chiko Mandala (a diagram that depicts Buddhist deities according to certain geometric formats and illustrates the Buddhist world view).
The honzon (principal object of worship at a temple) is Chiko Mandala (a diagram that depicts Buddhist deities according to certain geometric formats and illustrates the Buddhist world view).

sen.j: (2) 奈良市芝新屋町所在の元興寺。
sen.e: (2) Gango-ji Temple in Shibanoshinya-cho, Nara City.
(2) Gango-ji Temple in Shibanoshinya-cho, Nara City.
(2) Gango-ji Temple in Shibanoshinya-cho, Nara City.

sen.j: 東大寺の末寺で、宗派は華厳宗に属する。
sen.e: The temple is a branch temple of Todai-ji Temple, belonging to the Kegon sect.
The temple is a branch temple of Todai-ji Temple, belonging to the Kegon sect.
The temple is a branch temple of Todai-ji Temple, belonging to the Kegon sect.

sen.j: 本尊は十一面観音である。
sen.e: Honzon is Eleven-faced Kannon (Goddess of Mercy).
The honzon is Eleven-faced Kannon (Goddess of Mercy).
The honzon is Eleven-faced Kannon (Goddess of Mercy).

sen.j: 奈良市中院町の元興寺は「古都奈良の文化財」の一部として、世界遺産にも登録されている。
sen.e: Gango-ji Temple in Chuin-cho, Nara City is registered in the list of World Heritage as a part of 'Historic Monuments of Ancient Nara.'
Gango-ji Temple in Chuin-cho, Nara City is registered in the list of World Heritage as a part of 'Historic Monuments of Ancient Nara.'
Gango-ji Temple in Chuin-cho, Nara City is registered in the list of World Heritage as a part of 'Historic Monuments of Ancient Nara.'

sen.j: 上記2つの元興寺は、もともと同じ寺院の一部であるので、本項ではまとめて述べることとする。
sen.e: As the above-mentioned two Gango-ji Temple separated from one temple, they are dealt with together in this section.
As the above-mentioned two Gango-ji Temple separated from one temple, they are dealt with together in this section.
As the above-mentioned two Gango-ji Temple separated from one temple, they are dealt with together in this section.

sen.j: 現在、「史跡元興寺」として指定されている地域は（1）奈良市中院町の「元興寺極楽坊」、（2）同市芝新屋町の「元興寺（塔跡）」（3）同市西新屋町の「元興寺小塔院跡」の3か所である。
sen.e: At present, the following three regions are designated as 'The Historic site, Gango-ji Temple': (1) 'Gango-ji Temple Gokuraku-bo' in Chuin-cho, Nara City, (2) 'Gango-ji Temple (remains of pagoda)' in Shibanoshinya-cho, Nara City, (3) 'Remains of Shoto-in Temple of Gango-ji Temple' in Nishinoshinya-cho, Nara-City.

At present, the following three regions are designated as 'The Historic site, Gango-ji Temple': (1) 'Gango-ji Temple Gokuraku-bo' in Chuin-cho, Nara City, (2) 'Gango-ji Temple (remains of pagoda)' in Shibanoshinya-cho, Nara City, (3) 'Remains of Shoto-in Temple of Gango-ji Temple' in Nishinoshinya-cho, Nara-City.

At present, the following three regions are designated as 'The Historic site, Gango-ji Temple': (1) 'Gango-ji Temple Gokuraku-bo' in Chuin-cho, Nara City, (2) 'Gango-ji Temple (remains of pagoda)' in Shibanoshinya-cho, Nara City, (3) 'Remains of Shoto-in Temple of Gango-ji Temple' in Nishinoshinya-cho, Nara-City.

sen.j: これらはいずれも、蘇我馬子が6世紀末、飛鳥に建立した日本最古の本格的寺院、法興寺（現在の飛鳥寺）の後身である。
sen.e: All of these regions formerly belonged to Hoko-ji Temple (now Asuka-dera Temple), the oldest orthodox Buddhist temple in Japan, erected in Asuka by SOGA-no-Umako in the end of the sixth century.
All of these regions formerly belonged to Hoko-ji Temple (now Asuka-dera Temple), the oldest orthodox Buddhist temple in Japan, erected in Asuka by SOGA-no-Umako in the end of the sixth century.
All of these regions formerly belonged to Hoko-ji Temple (now Asuka-dera Temple), the oldest orthodox Buddhist temple in Japan, erected in Asuka by SOGA-no-Umako in the end of the sixth century.

sen.j: 和銅3年（710年）の平城京遷都に伴って、飛鳥にあった薬師寺、厩坂寺（のちの興福寺）、大官大寺（のちの大安寺）などは新都へ移転した。
sen.e: Following the transfer of the national capital to the Heijo-kyo in 710, Yakushi-ji Temple, Umaya-zaka-dera temple (later Kofuku-ji Temple), Daikandai-ji Temple (later Daian-ji Temple), etc. were transferred to the new capital.

Following the transfer of the national capital to the Heijo-kyo in 710, Yakushi-ji Temple, Umaya-zaka-dera Temple (later Kofuku-ji Temple), Daikandai-ji Temple (later Daian-ji Temple), etc. were transferred to the new capital.
sen.cmt: Daikandai-jiの後のTempleのｔを大文字にしました。
sen.e: Following the transfer of the national capital to the Heijo-kyo in 710, Yakushi-ji Temple, Umaya-zaka-dera Temple (later Kofuku-ji Temple), Daikandai-ji Temple (later Daian-ji Temple), etc. were transferred to the new capital.

sen.j: 法興寺は養老2年（718年）平城京へ移転したが、飛鳥の法興寺も廃止はされずに元の場所に残った。
sen.e: While Hoko-ji Temple was transferred to the Heijo-kyo in 718, Hoko-ji Temple in Asuka was left at the original site without being abolished.
While Hoko-ji Temple was transferred to the Heijo-kyo in 718, Hoko-ji Temple in Asuka was left at the original site without being abolished.
While Hoko-ji Temple was transferred to the Heijo-kyo in 718, Hoko-ji Temple in Asuka was left at the original site without being abolished.

sen.j: 通常、飛鳥にある寺を「法興寺」、平城京の方の寺を「元興寺」と称している。
sen.e: Generally, the temple in Asuka is referred to as 'Hoko-ji Temple,' while that in the Heijo-kyo is referred to as 'Gango-ji Temple.'
Generally, the temple in Asuka is referred to as 'Hoko-ji Temple,' while that in the Heijo-kyo is referred to as 'Gango-ji Temple.'
Generally, the temple in Asuka is referred to as 'Hoko-ji Temple,' while that in the Heijo-kyo is referred to as 'Gango-ji Temple.'

sen.j: 「法興」も「元興」も、日本で最初に仏法が興隆した寺院であるとの意である。
sen.e: Both terms of 'Hoko' and 'Gango' provide the temples with the meaning of the first temple in Japan where Buddhism thrived.
Both terms of 'Hoko' and 'Gango' provide the temples with the meaning of the first temple in Japan where Buddhism thrived.
Both terms of 'Hoko' and 'Gango' provide the temples with the meaning of the first temple in Japan where Buddhism thrived.

sen.j: 奈良時代の元興寺は三論宗と法相宗の道場として栄え、東大寺や興福寺と並ぶ大伽藍を誇っていた。
sen.e: Gango-ji Temple in the Nara period prospered as a Dojo (place of Buddhist practice or meditation) of the Sanron sect and the Hosso sect, boasting a gigantic scale of temple buildings and site comparable with Todai-ji Temple and Kofuku-ji Temple.

Gango-ji Temple in the Nara period prospered as a Dojo (place of Buddhist practice or meditation) of the Sanron sect and the Hosso sect, boasting a gigantic scale of temple buildings and site comparable with Todai-ji Temple and Kofuku-ji Temple.

Gango-ji Temple in the Nara period prospered as a Dojo (place of Buddhist practice or meditation) of the Sanron sect and the Hosso sect, boasting a gigantic scale of temple buildings and site comparable with Todai-ji Temple and Kofuku-ji Temple.

sen.j: 寺域は南北4町（約440メートル）、東西2町（約220メートル）と南北に細長かった。
sen.e: The temple site was long and slender in the north and south direction with about 440 meters in north and south and about 220 meters in east and west.
sen.cmt: 一例文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: The temple site was long and slender in the north and south direction with about 440 meters in north and south and about 220 meters in east and west.
The temple site was long and slender in the north and south direction with about 440 meters in north and south and about 220 meters in east and west.

sen.j: 興福寺の南にある猿沢池の南方、今日「ならまち（ならまち）」と通称される地区の大部分が元は元興寺の境内であった。
sen.e: The south of Sarusawa-ike Pond located in the south of Kofuku-ji Temple--most of the area called 'Nara-machi' today--were originally included in the precincts of Gango-ji Temple.
sen.cmt: 一例文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: The south of Sarusawa-ike Pond located in the south of Kofuku-ji Temple, most of the area called 'Nara-machi' today, was originally included in the precincts of Gango-ji Temple.
sen.cmt: Wereをwasに変更しました。また、-をコンマに変更しました。
sen.e: The south of Sarusawa-ike Pond located in the south of Kofuku-ji Temple, most of the area called 'Nara-machi' today, was originally included in the precincts of Gango-ji Temple.

sen.j: 猿沢池南東側にある交番のあたりが旧境内の北東端、奈良市音声館（奈良市鳴川町）のあたりが旧境内の南西端にあたる。
sen.e: The area where the police station in the southeast of Sarusawa-ike Pond is standing corresponds to the northeastern end of the old precincts, while the area where Nara City Onjo-Kan Hall (Narukawa-cho, Nara City) is standing corresponds to the southwestern end of those.

The southeast area of Sarusawa-ike Pond where the police station is located corresponds to the northeastern end of the old precincts, while the area where Nara City Onjo-Kan Hall (Narukawa-cho, Nara City) is located corresponds to the southwestern end of the precincts.
sen.cmt: より自然な訳にするために、左記のように変更しました。
sen.e: The southeast area of Sarusawa-ike Pond where the police station is located corresponds to the northeastern end of the old precincts, while the area where Nara City Onjo-Kan Hall (Narukawa-cho, Nara City) is located corresponds to the southwestern end of the precincts.

sen.j: 奈良においては東大寺、興福寺が勢力を増す一方で、元興寺は平安時代後半あたりから徐々に衰退していった。
sen.e: In contrast to Todai-ji Temple and Kofuku-ji Temple that increased in influence in Nara, Gango-ji Temple gradually declined after around the late Heian period.
In contrast to Todai-ji Temple and Kofuku-ji Temple that increased in influence in Nara, Gango-ji Temple gradually declined around the late Heian period.
In contrast to Todai-ji Temple and Kofuku-ji Temple that increased in influence in Nara, Gango-ji Temple gradually declined around the late Heian period.

sen.j: 11世紀前半の「堂舎損色検録帳」という史料によると、金堂をはじめとする元興寺の伽藍は、この頃には荒れ果てて見る影もなかったという。
sen.e: According to 'Dosha Sonshoku Kenroku Cho' (the record of damages of the temple), a historical material compiled in the early 11th century, temple buildings of Gango-ji Temple including Kon-do Hall (main hall of a Buddhist temple) were so ruined in those days that they appeared miserable.

According to 'Dosha Sonshoku Kenroku Cho' (the record of damages of the temple), a historical material compiled in the early 11th century, temple buildings of Gango-ji Temple including Kon-do Hall (main hall of a Buddhist temple) were so ruined in those days that they appeared miserable.

According to 'Dosha Sonshoku Kenroku Cho' (the record of damages of the temple), a historical material compiled in the early 11th century, temple buildings of Gango-ji Temple including Kon-do Hall (main hall of a Buddhist temple) were so ruined in those days that they appeared miserable.

sen.j: 元興寺には奈良時代の学僧・智光が描かせた阿弥陀浄土図（智光曼荼羅）があった。
sen.e: There was an Amida Jodozu (illustration of the Pure Land of Amida, also called Chiko Mandala) in Gango-ji Temple that was produced under the instruction of a scholar priest, Chiko in the Nara period.
sen.cmt: 一例文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: There was an Amida Jodozu (illustration of the Pure Land of Amida, also called Chiko Mandala) in Gango-ji Temple that was produced under the instruction of a scholar priest, Chiko, in the Nara period
sen.cmt: Chikoの後にコンマを入れました。
sen.e: There was an Amida Jodozu (illustration of the Pure Land of Amida, also called Chiko Mandala) in Gango-ji Temple that was produced under the instruction of a scholar priest, Chiko, in the Nara period

sen.j: 平安末期の末法思想の流行や阿弥陀信仰の隆盛とともにこの曼荼羅が信仰を集めるようになった。
sen.e: This Mandala became popular in line with the spread of Mappo-shiso (the "end of the world" belief) in the end of Heian period as well as the boom of worshiping Amida Buddha.
sen.cmt: 一例文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: This Mandala became popular in line with the spread of Mappo-shiso (the "end of the world" belief) in the end of the Heian period as well as the boom of worshiping Amida Buddha.
sen.cmt: Heian の前にtheを入れました。
sen.e: This Mandala became popular in line with the spread of Mappo-shiso (the "end of the world" belief) in the end of the Heian period as well as the boom of worshiping Amida Buddha.

sen.j: 曼荼羅を祀る堂は「極楽坊」と呼ばれて、次第に元興寺本体とは別の寺院として発展するようになった。
sen.e: The hall enshrining the Mandala was called 'Gokuraku-bo,' which gradually developed as a different temple from the original Gango-ji Temple.
The hall enshrining the Mandala was called 'Gokuraku-bo,' which gradually developed as a different temple from the original Gango-ji Temple.
The hall enshrining the Mandala was called 'Gokuraku-bo,' which gradually developed as a different temple from the original Gango-ji Temple.

sen.j: これが現在、奈良市中院町にある元興寺、通称元興寺極楽坊である。
sen.e: This hall is the Gango-ji Temple now located in Chuin-cho, Nara City, popularly known as Gango-ji Temple Gokuraku-bo.
This hall is the Gango-ji Temple now located in Chuin-cho, Nara City, popularly known as Gango-ji Temple Gokuraku-bo.
This hall is the Gango-ji Temple now located in Chuin-cho, Nara City, popularly known as Gango-ji Temple Gokuraku-bo.

sen.j: 現存する元興寺極楽坊の本堂と禅室は、奈良時代に智光をはじめとする僧たちが住んでいた僧房を鎌倉時代に改築したものである。
sen.e: The existing Hon-do Hall (main hall) and Zen-shitsu Room (room for Zen sitting meditation) of Gango-ji Temple Gokuraku-bo were originally priests' living quarters where priests including Chiko lived in the Nara period, which were reconstructed in the Kamakura period.

The existing Hon-do Hall (main hall) and Zen-shitsu Room (room for Zen sitting meditation) of Gango-ji Temple Gokuraku-bo were originally priests' living quarters where priests including Chiko lived in the Nara period, which were reconstructed in the Kamakura period.

The existing Hon-do Hall (main hall) and Zen-shitsu Room (room for Zen sitting meditation) of Gango-ji Temple Gokuraku-bo were originally priests' living quarters where priests including Chiko lived in the Nara period, which were reconstructed in the Kamakura period.

sen.j: 室町時代の宝徳3年（1451年）、土一揆のあおりで元興寺は炎上した。
sen.e: Getting a by-blow of a peasants' uprising in 1451 during the Muromachi period, Gango-ji Temple went up in flames.
sen.cmt: 一例文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Getting a by-blow of a peasants' uprising in 1451 during the Muromachi period, Gango-ji Temple went up in flames.
Getting a by-blow of a peasants' uprising in 1451 during the Muromachi period, Gango-ji Temple went up in flames.

sen.j: 五重塔などはかろうじて残ったが、金堂など主要堂宇や智光曼荼羅の原本は焼けてしまった。
sen.e: While Five-Storied Pagoda (called Goju-no-To) and other structures narrowly escaped the fire, main temple buildings such as Kon-do Hall and the original illustration of Chiko Mandala were burned down.
sen.cmt: 一例文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: While the Five-Storied Pagoda (called Goju-no-To) and other structures narrowly escaped the fire, main temple buildings such as the Kon-do Hall and the original illustration of Chiko Mandala were burned down.

While the Five-Storied Pagoda (called Goju-no-To) and other structures narrowly escaped the fire, main temple buildings such as the Kon-do Hall and the original illustration of Chiko Mandala were burned down.

sen.j: この頃を境に、寺は智光曼荼羅を祀る「極楽院」、五重塔を中心とする「元興寺観音堂」、それに「小塔院」の3つの寺院に分裂した。
sen.e: Around those days, the temple was divided into three temples: 'Gokuraku-in Temple' enshrining Chiko Mandala, 'Gango-ji Temple Kannon-do Hall (a temple dedicated to Kannon)' developing around Five-Storied Pagoda, and 'Shoto-in Temple.'

Around those days, the temple was divided into three temples: 'Gokuraku-in Temple' enshrining Chiko Mandala, 'Gango-ji Temple Kannon-do Hall (a temple dedicated to Kannon)' developing around the Five-Storied Pagoda, and 'Shoto-in Temple.'

Around those days, the temple was divided into three temples: 'Gokuraku-in Temple' enshrining Chiko Mandala, 'Gango-ji Temple Kannon-do Hall (a temple dedicated to Kannon)' developing around the Five-Storied Pagoda, and 'Shoto-in Temple.'

sen.j: 極楽院は奈良西大寺 (奈良市)の末寺となって真言律宗寺院となった。
sen.e: Gokuraku-in Temple became a branch temple of Saidai-ji Temple in Nara City, belonging to the Shingon Ritsu sect.
sen.cmt: 一例文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Gokuraku-in Temple became a branch temple of Saidai-ji Temple in Nara City, belonging to the Shingon Ritsu sect.
Gokuraku-in Temple became a branch temple of Saidai-ji Temple in Nara City, belonging to the Shingon Ritsu sect.

sen.j: 中世以降は智光曼荼羅、弘法大師、聖徳太子などの民間信仰の寺院として栄えた。
sen.e: The temple flourished as a temple for folk religion such as Chiko Mandala, Kobo Daishi (a posthumous title of the priest Kukai), Prince Shotoku since the Medieval period.
sen.cmt: 一例文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: The temple flourished as a temple for folk religion such as Chiko Mandala, Kobo Daishi (a posthumous title of the priest Kukai), Prince Shotoku after the Medieval period.
The temple flourished as a temple for folk religion such as Chiko Mandala, Kobo Daishi (a posthumous title of the priest Kukai), Prince Shotoku after the Medieval period.

sen.j: 一方、極楽院の南にある「元興寺観音堂」の方は東大寺の末寺となり、五重塔を中心とする寺院であった。
sen.e: On the other hand, 'Gango-ji Temple Kannon-do Hall' located in the south of Gokuraku-in Temple became a branch temple of Todai-ji Temple, which developed around Five-Storied Pagoda.
sen.cmt: 一例文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: On the other hand, 'Gango-ji Temple Kannon-do Hall' located in the south of Gokuraku-in Temple became a branch temple of Todai-ji Temple, which developed around the Five-Storied Pagoda.
On the other hand, 'Gango-ji Temple Kannon-do Hall' located in the south of Gokuraku-in Temple became a branch temple of Todai-ji Temple, which developed around the Five-Storied Pagoda.

sen.j: 室町時代の火災に焼け残った創建遺構の五重塔と観音堂は、江戸時代末期の安政6年（1859年）についに焼失した。
sen.e: The Five-Storied Pagoda and Kannon-do Hall, remains of the original Gango-ji Temple, which had escaped the fire broke out in the Muromachi period, were finally burned down in 1859 in the end of Edo period.
sen.cmt: 一例文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: The Five-Storied Pagoda and Kannon-do Hall, remains of the original Gango-ji Temple, which had escaped the fire broke out in the Muromachi period, were finally burned down in 1859 in the end of the Edo period.

The Five-Storied Pagoda and Kannon-do Hall, remains of the original Gango-ji Temple, which had escaped the fire broke out in the Muromachi period, were finally burned down in 1859 in the end of the Edo period.

sen.j: 以後は「元興寺」の寺号は継ぐものの衰退している。
sen.e: Afterward, the temple has been declining, although it succeeded to the temple name of 'Gango-ji Temple.'
sen.cmt: 一例文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Afterward, the temple has been declining, although it succeeded to the temple name of 'Gango-ji Temple.'
Afterward, the temple has been declining, although it succeeded to the temple name of 'Gango-ji Temple.'

sen.j: 極楽院は明治以降は荒れ果てた。
sen.e: Gokuraku-in Temple fell into ruin after the Meiji period.
sen.cmt: 一例文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Gokuraku-in Temple fell into ruin after the Meiji period.
Gokuraku-in Temple fell into ruin after the Meiji period.

sen.j: 現在国宝に指定されている本堂も1950年ころまでは床は落ち、屋根は破れて「化け物が出る」と言われたほどの荒れ方であった。
sen.e: Hon-do Hall, which is now designated as National Treasures, had been so ruined with broken floorboards and torn thatched roofs until around 1950 that it was ridiculed by saying, 'The temple is haunted.'
sen.cmt: 一例文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: The Hon-do Hall, which is now designated as a National Treasure, had been so ruined with broken floorboards and torn thatched roofs until around 1950 that it was ridiculed by saying, 'The temple is haunted.'
sen.cmt: Hon-doの前にTheを入れました。National Treasuresを単数にしました。
sen.e: The Hon-do Hall, which is now designated as a National Treasure, had been so ruined with broken floorboards and torn thatched roofs until around 1950 that it was ridiculed by saying, 'The temple is haunted.'

sen.j: 第二次世界大戦中の1943年に極楽院の住職となった辻村泰圓は戦災孤児のための社会福祉事業に尽力するかたわら、境内の整備や建物の修理を進めた。
sen.e: Taizen TSUJIMURA, who became the chief priest of Gokuraku-in Temple in 1943 during the World War II, encouraged the maintenance of the precincts and the repair of the building, while devoting himself to the social welfare work for war orphans.

Taizen TSUJIMURA, who became the chief priest of Gokuraku-in Temple in 1943 during the World War II, encouraged the maintenance of the precincts and the repair of the building, while devoting himself to the social welfare work for war orphans.

Taizen TSUJIMURA, who became the chief priest of Gokuraku-in Temple in 1943 during the World War II, encouraged the maintenance of the precincts and the repair of the building, while devoting himself to the social welfare work for war orphans.

sen.j: 1962年には辻村により境内に財団法人元興寺仏教民俗資料研究所が設立され（1978年に元興寺文化財研究所と改称）、1965年には寺宝を収蔵展示する収蔵庫が完成するなど、徐々に整備が進んだ。
sen.e: The precincts were gradually maintained: for example, TSUJIMURA established "The Foundation of Gango-ji Temple Research Center for Buddhism and Race Resources (財団法人元興寺仏教民俗資料研究所)" within the precincts in 1962 (the center has been renamed "Gangoji Cultural Property Research Center" since 1978), and a repository was established in 1965 for storing and exhibiting the temple's treasures.
sen.cmt: 「財団法人元興寺仏教民俗資料研究所」の訳がわかりません。
sen.e: The precincts were gradually maintained: for example, TSUJIMURA established "The Foundation of Gango-ji Temple Research Center for Buddhism and Race Resources (財団法人元興寺仏教民俗資料研究所)" within the precincts in 1962 (the center has been renamed "Gangoji Cultural Property Research Center" in 1978), and a repository was established in 1965 for storing and exhibiting the temple's treasures.
sen.cmt: 1978の前のsince をinに変更しました。
sen.e: The precincts were gradually maintained: for example, TSUJIMURA established "The Foundation of Gango-ji Temple Research Center for Buddhism and Race Resources (財団法人元興寺仏教民俗資料研究所)" within the precincts in 1962 (the center has been renamed "Gangoji Cultural Property Research Center" in 1978), and a repository was established in 1965 for storing and exhibiting the temple's treasures.

sen.j: 元興寺仏教民俗資料研究所は、本堂解体修理中に屋根裏から発見された数万点の庶民信仰資料（板塔婆など）を研究することを当初の目的として設立された。
sen.e: "The Foundation of Gango-ji Temple Research Center for Buddhism and Race Resources (財団法人元興寺仏教民俗資料研究所)" was established with the initial aim of studying the tens of thousands resources related to the popular faith (board stupa, etc.) that had been found from a loft during the demolition and repair work of Hon-do Hall.

"The Foundation of Gango-ji Temple Research Center for Buddhism and Race Resources (財団法人元興寺仏教民俗資料研究所)" was established with the initial aim of studying the tens of thousands resources related to the popular faith (board stupa, etc.) that had been found from a loft during the demolition and repair work of the Hon-do Hall.
sen.cmt: Hon-doの前にTheを入れました。National Treasuresを単数にしました。
sen.e: "The Foundation of Gango-ji Temple Research Center for Buddhism and Race Resources (財団法人元興寺仏教民俗資料研究所)" was established with the initial aim of studying the tens of thousands resources related to the popular faith (board stupa, etc.) that had been found from a loft during the demolition and repair work of the Hon-do Hall.

sen.j: 極楽院は1955年に「元興寺極楽坊」と改称、さらに1977年に「元興寺」と改称されている。
sen.e: Renamed 'Gango-ji Temple Gokuraku-bo' in 1955, Gokuraku-in Temple has been renamed 'Gango-ji Temple' since 1977.
Gokuraku-in Temple was renamed 'Gango-ji Temple Gokuraku-bo' in 1955 and again renamed 'Gango-ji Temple' in 1977.
sen.cmt: より意味を明確にするため、左記のように変更しました。
sen.e: Gokuraku-in Temple was renamed 'Gango-ji Temple Gokuraku-bo' in 1955 and again renamed 'Gango-ji Temple' in 1977.

sen.j: 奈良時代の元興寺伽藍は、南大門、中門、金堂（本尊は弥勒仏）、講堂、鐘堂、食堂（じきどう）が南北に一直線に並んだ。
sen.e: As for the temple buildings of Gango-ji Temple in the Nara period, Nandai-mon gate (literally, Great South Gate), Chu-mon gate (literally, Inner Gate), Kon-do Hall (Miroku Buddha is enshrined as Honzon), Ko-do Hall (lecture hall), Sho-do Hall (hall preserving the temple bell) and Jiki-do Hall (dining hall) were arranged on the straight from south to north.
sen.cmt: 一例文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: As for the temple buildings of Gango-ji Temple in the Nara period, the Nandai-mon gate (literally, Great South Gate), Chu-mon gate (literally, Inner Gate), Kon-do Hall (Miroku Buddha is enshrined as Honzon), Ko-do Hall (lecture hall), Sho-do Hall (hall preserving the temple bell) and Jiki-do Hall (dining hall) were arranged on the straight from south to north.

As for the temple buildings of Gango-ji Temple in the Nara period, the Nandai-mon gate (literally, Great South Gate), Chu-mon gate (literally, Inner Gate), Kon-do Hall (Miroku Buddha is enshrined as Honzon), Ko-do Hall (lecture hall), Sho-do Hall (hall preserving the temple bell) and Jiki-do Hall (dining hall) were arranged on the straight from south to north.

sen.j: 中門左右から伸びた回廊が金堂を囲み、講堂の左右に達していた。
sen.e: Furthermore, cloisters expanding from the right and left sides of Chu-mon surrounded the Kon-do Hall, which reached to the right and left sides of the Ko-do Hall.
sen.cmt: 一例文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Furthermore, cloisters expanding from the right and left sides of Chu-mon surrounded the Kon-do Hall, which reached to the right and left sides of the Ko-do Hall.
Furthermore, cloisters expanding from the right and left sides of Chu-mon surrounded the Kon-do Hall, which reached to the right and left sides of the Ko-do Hall.

sen.j: 回廊の外側、東には五重塔を中心とする東塔院、西には小塔院があった（小塔院には、小型の塔が屋内に安置されていたものと思われる）。
sen.e: There was To-to-in Temple spreading around Five-Storied Pagoda in the east of the outside cloisters, while there was Shoto-in Temple in the west of the outside cloisters (It is believed that a small pagoda was enshrined inside of the Shoto-in Temple).

There was To-to-in Temple spreading around the Five-Storied Pagoda in the east of the outside cloisters, while there was Shoto-in Temple in the west of the outside cloisters (It is believed that a small pagoda was enshrined inside of the Shoto-in Temple).

There was To-to-in Temple spreading around the Five-Storied Pagoda in the east of the outside cloisters, while there was Shoto-in Temple in the west of the outside cloisters (It is believed that a small pagoda was enshrined inside of the Shoto-in Temple).

sen.j: これらの建物はすべて焼失して現存しない。
sen.e: All of these buildings had already been burned down and disappeared.
All of these buildings had already been burned down and disappeared.
All of these buildings had already been burned down and disappeared.

sen.j: なお、講堂の背後左右には、数棟ずつの僧房（僧の居住する建物）があった。
sen.e: On the right and left sides behind the Ko-do Hall, there were several priests' living quarters.
On the right and left sides behind the Ko-do Hall, there were several priests' living quarters.
On the right and left sides behind the Ko-do Hall, there were several priests' living quarters.

sen.j: これは、東西に長い長屋のような建物であった。
sen.e: The structure of these living quarters looked like row houses extending east and west.
sen.cmt: 一例文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: The structure of these living quarters looked like row houses extending east and west.
The structure of these living quarters looked like row houses extending east and west.

sen.j: このうち東側手前にあった僧房を鎌倉時代に改造したものが、現存する本堂と禅室である。
sen.e: Of them, the priests' living quarters located at the fore part in the east were remodeled in the Kamakura period to be the existing Hon-do Hall and Zen-shitsu Room.
sen.cmt: 一例文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Of them, the priests' living quarters located at the fore part in the east were remodeled in the Kamakura period to be the existing Hon-do Hall and Zen-shitsu Room.
Of them, the priests' living quarters located at the fore part in the east were remodeled in the Kamakura period to be the existing Hon-do Hall and Zen-shitsu Room.

sen.j: 元興寺（奈良市中院町）
sen.e: Gango-ji Temple (Chuin-cho, Nara City)
Gango-ji Temple (Chuin-cho, Nara City)
Gango-ji Temple (Chuin-cho, Nara City)

sen.j: 本堂（国宝）－極楽坊本堂または極楽堂とも。
sen.e: Hon-do Hall (National Treasure) - also referred to as Gokuraku-bo Hon-do Hall or Gokuraku-do Hall.
Hon-do Hall (National Treasure) - also referred to as Gokuraku-bo Hon-do Hall or Gokuraku-do Hall.
Hon-do Hall (National Treasure) - also referred to as Gokuraku-bo Hon-do Hall or Gokuraku-do Hall.

sen.j: 寄棟造、瓦葺で、東を正面として建つ（東を正面とするのは阿弥陀堂建築の特色）。
sen.e: This hall style is classified into the Yosemune-Zukuri style (a square or rectangular building, covered with a hipped roof) with a tiled roof, whose facade looks east (the design of the facade looking east is a distinctive feature in constructing Amida-do Hall [temple hall having an enshrined image of Amitabha]).

This hall style is classified into the Yosemune-Zukuri style (a square or rectangular building, covered with a hipped roof) with a tiled roof, whose facade looks east (the design of the facade looking east is a distinctive feature in constructing Amida-do Hall [temple hall having an enshrined image of Amitabha]).

This hall style is classified into the Yosemune-Zukuri style (a square or rectangular building, covered with a hipped roof) with a tiled roof, whose facade looks east (the design of the facade looking east is a distinctive feature in constructing Amida-do Hall [temple hall having an enshrined image of Amitabha]).

sen.j: この建物は寄棟造の妻側（屋根の形が台形でなく三角形に見える側）を正面とする点、正面柱間を偶数の6間とし、中央に柱が来ている点が珍しい（仏教の堂塔は正面柱間を3間、5間などの奇数とし、正面中央に柱が来ないようにするのが普通）。
sen.e: This hall has several unusual designs as follows: the facade of the hall is the short side of the Yosemune-Zukuri style building (the side that the roof shape looks triangular, not trapezoid), and its facade has even-numbered six-bay pillars with a pillar in the center (the common facade of Buddhism temple buildings has uneven-numbered-bay pillars like three or five without a pillar in the center).

This hall has several unusual designs as follows: the facade of the hall is the short side of the Yosemune-Zukuri style building (the side that the roof shape looks triangular, not trapezoid), and its facade has even-numbered six-bay pillars with a pillar in the center (the common facade of Buddhism temple buildings has uneven-numbered-bay pillars like three or five without a pillar in the center).

This hall has several unusual designs as follows: the facade of the hall is the short side of the Yosemune-Zukuri style building (the side that the roof shape looks triangular, not trapezoid), and its facade has even-numbered six-bay pillars with a pillar in the center (the common facade of Buddhism temple buildings has uneven-numbered-bay pillars like three or five without a pillar in the center).

sen.j: 内部は板敷きの内陣の周囲を畳敷きの外陣がぐるりと囲んでいる。
sen.e: As for the inside of the hall, Naijin (inner sanctuary) with boarding floor is enclosed by Gejin (outer place of worship for public people) with tatami mat flooring.
sen.cmt: 一例文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: As for the inside of the hall, Naijin (inner sanctuary) with boarding floor is enclosed by Gejin (outer place of worship for public people) with tatami mat flooring.
As for the inside of the hall, Naijin (inner sanctuary) with boarding floor is enclosed by Gejin (outer place of worship for public people) with tatami mat flooring.

sen.j: 内陣の周囲を念仏を唱えながら歩き回る「行道」に適した構造になっている。
sen.e: This design is suitable for 'Gyodo'--the ascetic practices of walking around the Naijin with praying to Amida Buddha.
sen.cmt: 一例文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: This design is suitable for 'Gyodo'--the ascetic practices of walking around the Naijin with praying to Amida Buddha.
This design is suitable for 'Gyodo'--the ascetic practices of walking around the Naijin with praying to Amida Buddha.

sen.j: 鎌倉時代の寛元2年（1244年）、旧僧房の東端部分を改造したものである。
sen.e: This hall was originally the east end of the old priests' living quarters, which was remodeled in 1244 during the Nara period.
sen.cmt: 一例文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: This hall was originally the east end of the old priests' living quarters, which was remodeled in 1244 during the Kamakura period.
This hall was originally the east end of the old priests' living quarters, which was remodeled in 1244 during the Kamakura period.

sen.j: 内陣周囲の太い角柱や天井板材には奈良時代の部材が再用されている。
sen.e: Components in the Nara period were reused to turn into big Kakubashira (corner pillar with square or rectangular shape) surrounding Naijin and ceiling boards.
sen.cmt: 一例文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Components in the Nara period were reused to turn into big Kakubashira (corner pillar with square or rectangular shape) surrounding Naijin and ceiling boards.
Components in the Nara period were reused to turn into big Kakubashira (corner pillar with square or rectangular shape) surrounding Naijin and ceiling boards.

sen.j: また、屋根瓦の一部にも飛鳥～奈良時代の古瓦が使用されている。
sen.e: Moreover, old roof-tiles in the Asuka period and the Nara period were partially applied to the roof covering the present hall.
Moreover, old roof-tiles in the Asuka period and the Nara period were partially applied to the roof covering the present hall.
Moreover, old roof-tiles in the Asuka period and the Nara period were partially applied to the roof covering the present hall.

sen.j: ここに使われている古瓦は上部が細くすぼまり、下部が幅広い独特の形をしている。
sen.e: The old roof-tile reused has the peculiar shape of wide lower edge and tapered off upper edge.
sen.cmt: 一例文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: The old roof-tile reused has the peculiar shape of wide lower edge and tapered off upper edge.
The old roof-tile reused has the peculiar shape of wide lower edge and tapered off upper edge.

sen.j: この瓦を重ねる葺き方を行基葺（ぎょうきぶき）という。
sen.e: The roofed-style created by laying these tiles is called Gyoki roofed-style.
sen.cmt: 一例文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: The roofed-style created by laying these tiles is called Gyoki roofed-style.
The roofed-style created by laying these tiles is called Gyoki roofed-style.

sen.j: 禅室（国宝）－切妻造、瓦葺。
sen.e: Zen-shitsu Room (National Treasure) - Kirizuma-zukuri style (an architectural style with a gabled roof) with a tiled roof.
Zen-shitsu Room (National Treasure) - Kirizuma-zukuri style (an architectural style with a gabled roof) with a tiled roof.
Zen-shitsu Room (National Treasure) - Kirizuma-zukuri style (an architectural style with a gabled roof) with a tiled roof.

sen.j: 本堂の西に軒を接して建つ。
sen.e: Zen-shitsu Room stands closely to the west side of Hon-do Hall.
The Zen-shitsu Room stands closely to the west side of the Hon-do Hall.
sen.cmt: Zen-shitsuとHon-doの前にTheを入れました。
sen.e: The Zen-shitsu Room stands closely to the west side of the Hon-do Hall.

sen.j: 元は現・本堂も含んで東西に長いひと続きの僧房であったものを鎌倉時代に改築したものである。
sen.e: The room was originally a series of the old priests' living quarters long extending east and west, including a part of the present Hon-do Hall, which was reconstructed in the Kamakura period.
The room was originally a series of the old priests' living quarters long extending east and west, including a part of the present Hon-do Hall, which was reconstructed in the Kamakura period.
The room was originally a series of the old priests' living quarters long extending east and west, including a part of the present Hon-do Hall, which was reconstructed in the Kamakura period.

sen.j: 正面の4箇所に板扉があることからわかるように、現存部分は4区画分である。
sen.e: Boarding doors fixed in four places of facade shows that the existing parts consists of four living quarters.
sen.cmt: 一例文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Boarding doors fixed in four places of the facade shows that the existing parts consist of four living quarters.
sen.cmt: facadeの前にthe を入れました。また、consistsのsを削除しました。
sen.e: Boarding doors fixed in four places of the facade shows that the existing parts consist of four living quarters.

sen.j: 1区画には5～8人の僧が生活していたという。
sen.e: It is believed that five to eight priests lived in each quarter.
sen.cmt: 一例文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: It is believed that five to eight priests lived in each quarter.
It is believed that five to eight priests lived in each quarter.

sen.j: 本堂と同様、部材や屋根瓦の一部には奈良時代のものが残っている。
sen.e: As Hon-do Hall, components and roof-tiles of this room are those used in the Nara period.
As with the Hon-do Hall, components and roof-tiles of this room are those used in the Nara period.
sen.cmt: Asの後にwithとtheをいれました。
sen.e: As with the Hon-do Hall, components and roof-tiles of this room are those used in the Nara period.

sen.j: なお、2000年の元興寺文化財研究所の発表によれば、禅室の部材を年輪年代測定法で調査したところ、西暦582年伐採の樹木が使用されているとのことである。
sen.e: In addition, according to the report issued by Gangoji Cultural Property Research Center in 2000, an examination into the components of Zen-shitsu Room with the dendrochronological technique shows that those components included trees cut down in 582.
sen.cmt: 一例文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: In addition, according to the report issued by Gangoji Cultural Property Research Center in 2000, an examination into the components of the Zen-shitsu Room with the dendrochronological technique shows that those components included trees cut down in 582.

In addition, according to the report issued by Gangoji Cultural Property Research Center in 2000, an examination into the components of the Zen-shitsu Room with the dendrochronological technique shows that those components included trees cut down in 582.

sen.j: 事実とすれば、本建物の一部には法隆寺西院伽藍よりも古い材木が使用されていることになる。
sen.e: This means, if it is true, that part of this structure used older lumber than that used for constructing the temple buildings of Horyu-ji Temple Sai-in.
sen.cmt: 一例文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: This means, if it is true, that part of this structure used older lumber than that used for constructing the temple buildings of Horyu-ji Temple Sai-in.
This means, if it is true, that part of this structure used older lumber than that used for constructing the temple buildings of Horyu-ji Temple Sai-in.

sen.j: 東門（重文）－東大寺の門を移築したもの。
sen.e: East Gate (National Important Cultural Property) - a gate brought over from Todai-ji Temple and reassembled.
East Gate (National Important Cultural Property) - a gate brought over from Todai-ji Temple and reassembled.
East Gate (National Important Cultural Property) - a gate brought over from Todai-ji Temple and reassembled.

sen.j: 室町時代。
sen.e: The Muromachi period.
sen.cmt: 文の前後のつながりがわかりません。
sen.e: The Muromachi period.
The Muromachi period.

tit.j: 元興寺（奈良市芝新屋町）

sen.j: 五重塔跡－奈良時代から残る創建遺構。
sen.e: The remains of Five-Storied Pagoda - the ancient structural remains that have survived since the Nara period when Gango-ji Temple was first built.
sen.cmt: 一例文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: The remains of the Five-Storied Pagoda - the ancient structural remains that have survived since the Nara period.
sen.cmt: Five-Storied Pagodaにtheをつけました。when Gango-ji Temple was first builtは原文には含まれていないので削除しました。
sen.e: The remains of the Five-Storied Pagoda - the ancient structural remains that have survived since the Nara period.

sen.j: 一辺9,65m総高72,7mの東寺五重塔より大きい超大型塔があったが、1859年（安政6）に、観音堂などとともに焼失。
sen.e: With an extra-large scale of 9.65m on a side and 72.7m in total height, the pagoda was larger than the Five-Storied Pagoda of To-ji Temple, which was burned down in 1859 along with Kannon-do Hall and others.
sen.cmt: 一例文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: With an extra-large scale of 9.65m on a side and 72.7m in total height, the pagoda was larger than the Five-Storied Pagoda of To-ji Temple, which was burned down in 1859 along with Kannon-do Hall and others.

With an extra-large scale of 9.65m on a side and 72.7m in total height, the pagoda was larger than the Five-Storied Pagoda of To-ji Temple, which was burned down in 1859 along with Kannon-do Hall and others.

sen.j: 現在まで再建されていない。
sen.e: The pagoda has not yet been reconstructed.
The pagoda has not yet been reconstructed.
The pagoda has not yet been reconstructed.

sen.j: 現在、かたわらに1935年頃再建された小堂が建つのみで、それより古い建物は残っていない。
sen.e: At present, there is only a small pagoda beside the remains of Five-Storied Pagoda that was rebuilt in around 1935, which is the oldest structure existing.
At present, a small pagoda, which was rebuilt around 1935, stands beside the remains of the Five-Storied Pagoda and no other buildings older than the small pagoda remain.
sen.cmt: 関係代名詞の先行詞をより明確にするために左記のように変更しました。Five-Storied Pagodaにtheをつけました。
sen.e: At present, a small pagoda, which was rebuilt around 1935, stands beside the remains of the Five-Storied Pagoda and no other buildings older than the small pagoda remain.

sen.j: 元興寺（奈良市中院町）
sen.e: Gango-ji Temple (Chuin-cho, Nara City)

sen.e: National Treasures

sen.j: 本堂
sen.e: Hon-do Hall
Hon-do Hall

sen.j: 禅室
sen.e: Zen-shitsu Room
Zen-shitsu Room

sen.j: 五重小塔－収蔵庫に安置。
sen.e: Five-Storied Small Pagoda - enshrined in the repository.
Five-Storied Small Pagoda - enshrined in the repository.
Five-Storied Small Pagoda - enshrined in the repository.

sen.j: 奈良時代。
sen.e: The Nara period.
sen.cmt: 文の前後のつながりがわかりません。
sen.e: The Nara period.
The Nara period.

sen.j: 高さ5.5メートルほどの小塔だが、「工芸品」ではなく「建造物」として国宝に指定されている。
sen.e: Despite its small size of about 5.5m high, it is designated as National Treasures by the category of 'architecture,' not by the category of 'handicraft.'
Despite its small size of about 5.5m high, it is designated as a National Treasure in the category of 'architecture,' not in the category of 'handicraft.'
sen.cmt: National Treasuresを単数に変更しました。また、byをinに変更しました。
sen.e: Despite its small size of about 5.5m high, it is designated as a National Treasure in the category of 'architecture,' not in the category of 'handicraft.'

sen.j: 屋内にあったため傷みが少ない。
sen.e: Enshrined indoors, the pagoda has suffered from little damages.
sen.cmt: 一例文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Enshrined indoors, the pagoda has suffered from little damages.
Enshrined indoors, the pagoda has suffered from little damages.

sen.j: 奈良時代の建築を知るうえで貴重な資料である。
sen.e: Therefore, it is regarded as a valuable data to know the construction in the Nara period.
sen.cmt: 一例文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Therefore, it is regarded as a valuable material to know the construction in the Nara period.
Therefore, it is regarded as a valuable material to know the construction in the Nara period.

sen.j: 内部構造まで省略せずに造られている。
sen.e: The pagoda was constructed so sophisticatedly that even internal structure was far from being simplified.
The pagoda was constructed so sophisticatedly that even internal structure was far from being simplified.
The pagoda was constructed so sophisticatedly that even internal structure was far from being simplified.
